intro: Diplotaxis arvensis, commonly known as field cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves that are often hairy. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
